greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of parts in all k-times partitions of n into distinct parts; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Row n is binomial transform of the n-th row of triangle A327632.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..200, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, [1, 0],
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = With[{}, If[n==0, Return@{1, 0}]; If[k == 0, Return@{1, 1}]; If[i(i + 1)/2 < n, Return@{0, 0}]; b[n, i - 1, k] + Function[h, Function[f, f + {0, f[[1]] h[[2]]/h[[1]]}][h[[1]] b[n - i, Min[n - i, i - 1], k]]][b[i, i, k - 1]]];
Table[A[n, d - n], {d, 0, 14}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 03 2020, after Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 19 2019
